Bioshock Infinite is the opposite of a Bioshock game. Bioshock is a game filled with mystery. The setting is a mysterious and eerie place with creepy yet unique enemies. Bioshock Infinite, on the other hand, is a much less dark game. Still, it has a lot of dark elements, but Infinite seems much more cheery. It's setting is a town in the sky, which is a setting that is lit up with sunlight, equipped with beaches and bars. The enemies are normal people and not Big Daddies. Despite this, I still think Infinite's setting is still really solid. It's one of the best elements of the game and most of the time I prefer colorful and more lively settings, though the original Bioshock's was so eerie and provided sense of fun when discovering a new area that I feel that the original's is better by a sliver. Basically, the original Bioshock's was more intriguing but Infinite's is more lively and fun. Though the setting isn't the only thing that matters. Infinite has a really good story. A lot of people complained that Infinite's ending was confusing, yet, I didn't really feel the same. It can be confusing but as long as you understand The Many Worlds Theory it isn't that hard to comprehend, and even if you don't get it you can just look up a Youtube video explaining the ending. The characters are great and the combat feels still really good. I do feel that the original Bioshock's combat is better. One of the best parts of the combat of Bioshock was that you had to sometimes resort to your plasmids instead of constantly using your guns because there could be a shortage of ammo. For a 2013 game, this game looks great. Another compliment I have to give this game is that traversing through Columbia, the setting of Infinite, is really fun despite there being no mystery element. Overall, I really enjoyed my time with Infinite and feel it was another great entry to the Bioshock franchise.

Score: 8/10

If you liked BioShock 1 and 2 for the gameplay, this game is a fine addition to the franchise. But if you liked BioShock 1 and 2 for the story, this one pales in comparison.

I feel like Infinite had a lot of potential, especially with its setting firmly rooted in extreme patriotism, evangelical zionism, Jim Crow-era white supremacy and segregation, and exploitation of the poor working class American...and then failed to deliver any meaningful or impactful story point, and actually UNDERCUT its own message by playing the "both sides are equally bad" card with Daisy. The twist at the end is certainly a twist, but it feels very unfulfilling. I honestly feel like the game's story suffers from severely wasted potential, and fails to deliver any meaningful or impactful story out of it. I walked away from the game thinking "wow, white christian evangelicals kinda suck, huh." Which, let's be honest, I've already known for YEARS.

But if you're just in it for all the cool sci-fi concepts and creative ways to kill people using magical alcoholic beverages, it runs smooth, looks great, and will probably slake your bloodlust for a while.

Otherwise? Not recommended.

Un GROS reproche cependant concernant le choix des armes. Elle n'ont aucune originalité. Là ou Bioshock 2 nous livrait des harpons, des foreuses et des visseuses, là, il faudra se contenter des poncifs habituels à savoir Sniper, Pistolet, Pompe et Roquette.
Seul le fourneau-radar montre du potentiel mais il n'est disponible que dans les DLC.

J'ai beaucoup plus apprécié les phases de contemplation et d'exploration que les gunfights, qui étaient frustrants car on se fait canarder de partout sans savoir où tirer.

A breath taking atmosphere where you really feel you're up in the clouds and how much of an improvement over the last game where the most you do is just clear every room out with little to no interaction. The world is gigantic this isn't a game you can speed run in 2-3 hours if you know your way through the game. Now you've got people to interact with and you can do good or bad stuff such as steal from cash registers getting yourself in gun fights you could have totally avoided. There is two mechanics they added to this game you'll really like one of which makes travelling around areas easier. Lets call it a steam punk grapple hook (skyhook). The other is how Elizabeth's powers which are difficult to describe without ruining the game. The games difficulty is balanced once again. Not like bioshock 2 where you've got to spam the ice blast or something along those lines to survive alpha big daddies or certain boss battles. The enemies maintain their strength levels as the game progresses. Best of all in almost all enemies that are human head shots are lethal. Take note game designers! This is what your customers want. I see a cop an hour later in the game still 3-ish bullets depending on what gun and all or if i get lucky one head shot with a hand cannon. Skill is rewarded.

If anything this doesn't really feel like a bioshock game to me, it's a great game and I'll be sure to play it a few more times this year but sure there are powers and all but the controls were changed again for the 3rd time. No map to help find voice recordings or other treasures. The arrow is replaced with this vanishing animated arrow which is a nice touch that goes away to make the game more immersive. You've got two weapons now you can hold was kind of a down grade to me. Sure in Bioshock 1 all I really used was the machine gun and the grenade launcher but stripping us of the option is not a good thing especially when you play the DLC Elizabeth can have a ton of guns. You've got plasmids the kind to upgrade your stats still in this game but instead of the ton of options you had in #2 they are replaced with 4 wearable items you'll find better items as the game progresses and about 8 powers you get throughout the game as well in a fashion you've got plenty of time to digest them. Most are quite useful depending on the situation but when i see fire i call it incinerate. Someone didn't think it was a good idea to give the player a wrench or something but you've got an execution option similar to the darkness 2K games was apart of. Then again I rarely used the drill in #2. The skyhook does some beautiful work beheading enemies I'll give it that but when you are low on ammo which will happen in two places near the end of the game no matter how much ammo Elizabeth gives you it won't seem enough such as the fight where it's a ton of zeppelins attacking you. Another thing is there isn't a little sister to protect or a big sister to take half your ammo supply away. I'm kind of happy about that as #2 getting the highest ranking you got to protect about 21 of them. But I did find that a lot of the enemies looked alike in this game. There were a lot more guns at our disposal depending on our style such as sniper rifles which is a first. The game is gigantic so it makes sense. Some enemies or bosses there was lots of creativity too. Such as fighting Elizabeth's mothers ghost. I do miss the hack feature from #2 and not that annoying pipe game. Everything you want to buy is in the same currency too which if you find all the lock picks you can and go out of your way to find the others you'll do quite well in this game but it can get annoying as everything spits out of vending machines that all look alike at first glance. The art direction how they did Elizabeth seems like a Disney princess instead of a character as silly as that sounds.

All in all it's a great game that you won't just beat in an hour and move onto something else. The DLC in this game is garbage in my opinion other than the boost to your stats and the golden guns you get so avoid them at all cost or don't expect much more than an unfair, unforgiving mess of ideas that should been left on the cutting room floor.

Оставлю послесловие в начале обзора: 
После прохождения Infinite я изменил своё отношение к играм, одиночные игры действительно прекрасны. Поэтому я и закупился лучшими из них на ближайшую пару лет (например, Бэтменом и Ведьмаком).

Итак, спустя 2 месяца с момента прохождения основной части Infinite и первого обзора, я готов поделиться мыслями по поводу этого. Инфинит очень сильно меня зацепил, я никогда раньше не получал таких ярких, сильных и различных эмоций, как во время его прохождения. Я около 3 дней тогда провёл в раздумьях о нём, как о его истории, так и о его героях. Я очень привязался ко всему, что встретил на своём пути, и в остальных частях серии произошло тоже самое, но об этом чуть позже. 
Сначала я считал, что для меня эта история уже целостна и завершёна, но позже меня охватило непреодолимое желание узнать, что же такого там, в DLC. Да, и ради этого я докупил все остальные игры серии, которые до сего момента проходил взахлёб, одновременно и ожидая развязки истории об Элизабет и Букере, и влюбляясь в Восторг. Я рад, что посвятил 105 часов своей жизни миру Биошока, особенно в момент 18-летия (ранее я бы не понял и не прочувствовал всё это, теперь же был морально готов). Каждую из игр серии я могу охарактеризовать как трагедию со счастливым концом (вроде бы всё кончается благоприятно (относительно), но так грустно на душе становится). 
Оба мира невероятно проработаны, я медленно путешествовал по ним, разглядывая каждую деталь. Атмосферность необыкновенная! Когда говорят о Биошоке, упоминают в первую очередь историю, но, блин, какой же прекрасный тут геймплей! Да, меня он затянул, даже во втором Биошоке мне нравилось защищать маленьких сестричек, хотя многие находили это однообразным. На описание всех доступных возможностей ушло бы немало времени. 
А что же история? Все персонажи очень харизматичны и все они мне крайне нравятся (и Сушонг, и Синклер, и Райан, и Лютесы, и, в особенности, Элизабет и Элеонора, и Тененбаум, и далее, далее...). Может, это всё мои эмоции? Но ведь у всех этих персонажей так подробно расписаны мысли, намерения и действия, что невозможно их позабыть. Да, после полного прохождения я могу заявить, что временная петля замкнута, и всё восхитительно переплетено. 
Пока я писал всё это, почти забыл о самом главном. Я никогда не видел такой истории, как в Infinite, а Burial at Sea - это вообще уникальность. Я грустил, злился и восхищался одновременно. Кажется, я начинаю повторяться. Но добавлю, что здесь поднимается целая куча проблем, связанных с пороками общества, параллельными вселенными и всем остальным. Была бы это книга, аргументов на любую проблему в сочинении на ЕГЭ по русскому хватило бы. Ладно, я немного затянул, ведь я не мастер в написании обзоров, и меня никто не заставлял писать его. Вряд ли его даже кто-нибудь прочитает, но всё же. Искреннее спасибо Биошоку за пережитое, я надеюсь, память о нём никогда не умрёт, его будут помнить. Я ведь узнал о том, что его стоит пройти. Привет и прощай, Элизабет!

- Jogo bonito: o jogo tem um estilo steampunk bem legal, e se passa na maioria em uma cidade levitando em nuvens, a paleta de cores é bem estilosa também.

Eu realmente curti o jogo.

Observação para o pessoal do Linux: o sistema de saves desse jogo no Linux pode ser uma dor de cabeça,  o sistema de cloud não funciona. Então evite formatar o PC nesse período em que está jogando, para evitar estresse. [h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Great game, will blow you away.
Some flaws, but they can be easily ignored.
Worth your time and money.
100% would replay.
Runs smoothly.

[h1]INTRO[/h1]
Let me tell you this first, BioShock Infinite is an amazing game, I would definitely replay it, and suggest it to you. The whole premise is fascinating and the atmosphere is breathtaking. The graphics are pretty good with audio that makes the scenes come alive. Combat is pretty average, and the AI isn't all that smart. The only huge con I can see is the gameplay. Sure it runs smoothly but is the game engaging? Not to the fullest extent.

[h1]CONSISTENCY[/h1]
The beginning of the game starts out really strong, making a huge impact on the player. Then towards the middle it begins to go downhill in quality. Some of the environments that were once entrancing now become very obviously, poorly disguised arenas for fighting. You can predict you're gonna be in a fight scene because of environmental cues, like the tears and props. This takes alot of fun out of the game. I want to be surprised by the enemy, not expecting it sooner or later.

[h1]BASIC GAMEPLAY[/h1]
Aka the one HUGE thing I have to bash on; it can get pretty boring or frustrating at times. Not just because of the occesional bug. The levels (or chapters) of the game are quite linear with little exploration or interactability with the environment. It's basically walk..fight the enemy...walk..some story....and then repeat the whole process again. And again. And again. In other words it can get annoying and repetitive. Fights are fun but 30 chapters in? Nah.

[h1]EXPLORATION[/h1]
Exploring in this game is non-existent. There are extra things you can find if you wander a few feet off the beaten path but the game is definitely not an open-world (not that it was supposed to be). You're stuck on a linear path and you're restricted to it. Any items you find probably aren't worthwhile or even rewarding for that matter. Spending extra hours to search every nook and cranny is useless unless you really need supplies or just want achievements. Past the initial excitement, it will get boring, I promise you.

So if you're looking for a game where you can find stuff, live out your dreams to be a brazen adventurer, have freedom and options, as well as not be stuck to a linear level path... this is not a game for you. Of course Bioshock wasn't marketed as a free-roam game, but the lack of exploration makes the game seems small and empty at times. It breaks the immersion when you realize- oh yeah, it's just a game.

[h1]INTERACTABILITY[/h1]
A good-sized part of the disappointment in this game is the interactibility, which somewhat ties into its exploration aspect (or lack thereof). Environments can be lively with bustling npcs but they become dull when you realize you can't directly interact with them, unless you count shooting. You interacting with your environment consists of just finding items that you will use immediately. Sure there are dollar machines, telescopes, hidden voxophones plus upgrades, and spare change, but there's little more than that (but you can turn on sinks and flush toilets, so thanks 2K). If you're alright with the bare minumumn of gameplay, kudos to you; have fun.

Also, inventories are pretty dumbed down- since there's not really an inventory in the first place. There's a listing of what your objective is, what voxophones you have, your upgrades and gear etc etc, but other than that, there's not much. No crafting, skill tee, item details, or commentary. The gameplay lacks depth. Maybe I'm asking too much from this game but I honestly expected a lot more than just walking and crude fighting.

[h1]AUDIO[/h1]
This brings me to the audio in this game, which is amazing. The soundtrack really adds ambiance.. And the conversations when you walk past the NPC.. woooo. You can hear them in one of your ears and when you turn around you'll hear them in the other ear. Alright, maybe I'm just an audiophile but I do enjoy the surround sound feature.

[h1]COMBAT[/h1]
About the combat...there's a two weapon limit and that sucks literal ass. The vigors add a little bit to the game. They're basically equal to having an sp system and skills. It's not that great, but the idea is nice and makes the combat an ounce more fun. The enemies are creative-ish, kind of stupid but they're a jolly-good time to fight.

The skylines and tears can be useful in combat but they're not really necessary. They almost seem gimmicky and for show to follow the game's theme(they ARE FUNCTIONAL however). The upgrades in the game, while cleverly implemented, don't feel meaningful when you buy them. Power-wise, you won't really develop or see clear progression, which definitely isn't good if you get a kick out of that type of stuff. There's melee as well, of course, but not many other features like in other games...its the bare bones of combat really.

Occasionally [in battle] you might get a bug which may make you restart the whole chapter, since this game doesn't have manual save (UNLESS I MISSED THAT?!). It just has checkpoints which means if you if you want to go back, you're going to have to go aaaall the way back and re-find all the items that you've already found...which can be a pain in the ass.

[strike]There was this one scene where one of the enemies bugged and had me running around 30 minutes looking for it until I realized my searching was futile. The combat music still haunts my head to this very day.[/strike]

[h1]CHARACTERS[/h1]
Booker is alright. He's average. Not very stand-out but pretty badass. Classic MC. His story arc is certainly interesting once you hit the end of the game and begin to understand it ALL.

Now onto Elizabeth. When you are without Elizabeth you can get pretty lonely but when you ARE with her she can get annoying. As in so annoying, you wish the game would let you shoot her. She IS very helpful but she never shuts up and always ends up getting in the way. A pretty nice character though she's not really one-of-a-kind.


[h1]STORYLINE AND CONCLUSION[/h1]
Finally, after saying all this, I still like the game- even with its dull moments and occasional hiccups. [i]Bioshock Infinite[/I] is a good game. Not just any good game. A game that will go down in many peoples' all-time favourites. It's timeless. The world-building is incredible, with an immersive story and lively characters. There is definitely appeal and charm in the whole setting of the game. With the contrast in atmosphere's and environments that WILL transport you back into an alternate 1900s with creepy cult leaders and flashy cities hidden amongst the clouds. If you, yourself, can overlook all the nits-picks, [i]BSI's[/i] flaws will pale in comparison with its greatness. I love this game and hopefully you will too.

[h1]ГГ (главные герои)[/h1]
О....[b][i]Элизабет[/i][/b].......она добра, умна, красива и молода....УМЕЕТ ВСКРЫВАТЬ ЗАМКИ ЛЮБОЙ СЛОЖНОСТИ, ПОДГОНЯЕТ НАМ ПОРОЙ БАБКИ, РАЗГАДЫВАЕТ ШИФРЫ, СНАБЖАЕТ ВО ВРЕМЯ БОЯ ПРИПАСАМИ, А ТАКЖЕ ОТКРЫВАЕТ РАЗЛОМЫ ВО ВРЕМЕНИ И ПРОСТРАНСТВЕ! Одним словом - я б женился)
Ну и собственно [b][i]Букер Девитт[/i][/b], тот, кем мы всю игру умело крошим противником и защищаем нашу [b][i]Элизабет[/i][/b]. В принципе не плохой чувак, но много ранее косячил, поэтому и пришлось сорваться в Колумбию скажем так.
[h1]Сюжет[/h1]
Сюжет в играх BioShock это вообще отдельная тема, а в BioShock Infinite так вообще....[spoiler][strike]Хотел добавить интересный спойлер про сюжет и связь во всем частях игры, но лучше поиграйте сами и получите удовольствие от разгадки[/strike][/spoiler] На первый взгляд он мне показался каким-то "клише" - есть человек, который возомнил себя чуть ли не богом, создающий некий рай для белых людей,и, соответственно, противоборствующая его политике и действиям сторона...Но! Я так рад, что мне это лишь показалось) Сюжет закручен и заверчен так, что мама не горюй! После того, как проходишь игру и смотришь финальную заставку - вообще мозги кипят и челюсь отваливается...Что тем самым дает лишь радость за то , что познал его полностью.
[h1]Итог[/h1]
Начиная проходить игру давно, когда она вышла - честно, забросил её на начале, так и не вникнув, а зря! Я бы сказал, что жалею об этом, но зачем жалеть, ведь всё таки я испытал то наслаждение от прохождения игры, который смогла передать [b]BioShock Infinite[/b].
[b][u]Твёрдая 10/10![/u][/b]
